column6:
Class I - symptoms of HEART FAILURE only at activity levels that would limit normal individuals
Class II - symptoms of HEART FAILURE with ordinary exertion
Class III - symptoms of HEART FAILURE with less than ordinary exertion
Class IV - symptoms of HEART FAILURE at rest

column2: Congestive Heart Failure, Follow Up, Signs/Symptoms Decompensation
column6:
BP < 80 or > 180
Pulse < 40 or > 120
Adults RR > 24
Low O2 sat

column2: Congestive Heart Failure, Follow Up, Checklist
column6:
EKG: q12 months if stable, SOS if change in status
 LABS: *Once- patients > age 65 thyroid test 
*q3months – electrolytes and Cr date / result
 *q6months:
 Hyperlipidemia – date / result
Diabetes – date / result
 *Once/year – CBC (anemia can exacerbate CHF) date / result

column2: Congestive Heart Failure, Follow Up, Assessment / Follow up, Assessment
column6:
If blood pressure and symptoms stable --> 4months
If hypertension – change medication --> 1 month
If worse dyspnea – increase furosemide --> 2 weeks
